sentences.en: He became rebarbative and prickly and spiteful; I find his obsequiousness repellent.
sentences.cn: 他变得令人讨厌、易发怒,怀有恶意; 我发现他的奉承令人厌恶.

sentences.en: He was free from all sycophancy or obsequiousness in the face of the reactionary ruling class.
sentences.cn: 他在反动统治阶级面前没有丝毫的奴颜与媚骨。
我发现他令人生厌的谄媚.

sentences.en: I think of, you have a lot of night to come below fair door the government official of beg, their obsequiousness artful tongue should compare money baldicoot brillant and decuple.
sentences.cn: 我便想到，您相公门下有许多夜来乞求的官吏，他们的媚骨巧舌要比钱秃子高明十倍。

sentences.en: I told him to get lost and leave me alone and his tone quickly changed from obsequiousness to outright anger.
sentences.cn: 我叫他滚开，不要来烦我，他的口气一下子就从逢迎谄媚变成了勃然大怒。

sentences.en: We should be on guard against obsequiousness under the name of popularization.
sentences.cn: 我们必须警惕在平民化名义下的媚俗化趋势.
